alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:41AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern St. Bernard, southwestern Orleans, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 415 AM CDT... At 341 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Madisonville to Shell Beach. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Avondale, Metairie, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Poydras, River Ridge, Elmwood, Violet, Terrytown, Meraux, Bridge City and Shell Beach. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 227 and 246. Interstate 510 between mile markers 2 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
